name: sfchronicle
text:
Two teachers at Jesse Bethel High School in Vallejo were placed on administrative leave last week following an outcry from parents who were disturbed to hear them talk disparagingly about students.
https://t.co/NfJ6rZqVTw

name: sfchronicle
text:
California hoping to contain #coronavirus spread as national cases surge.

@ErinAllday has the full story here: https://t.co/6c4yW69iO5 https://t.co/wbGvzRgK7b

name: sfchronicle
text: State officials order California Republican Party to immediately stop collecting mail ballots for the November election via unofficial drop boxes it set up in at least three counties. https://t.co/wA7mmvkUpu

name: sfchronicle
text:
Calif. Senator @KamalaHarris opted to participate virtually in today's Amy Coney Barrett hearing, saying the room was not safe because two Republicans on the committee recently tested positive for the coronavirus.

@TalKopan's takeaways: https://t.co/fWrw0sGO8m

name: sfchronicle
text:
Billy Beane, the “Moneyball” mastermind who has guided the A’s for 23 years, might have a foot out the door if a merger between Beane’s new investment venture and Red Sox owner John Henry’s Fenway Sports Group goes through.
https://t.co/0gsSY9g6kB

name: sfchronicle
text: Restaurant critic Soleil Ho (@hooleil) says Yelp’s new initiative of alerting users to acute incidents of racism, “while noble, is fairly toothless.” https://t.co/4TXLgkZAYE

name: sfchronicle
text:
Californians leave for Texas in numbers, making politically red state closer to purple.

Story by @mlevinreports of @CALmatters: https://t.co/c8uigOK488

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @SportingGreenSF: “Heartbroken”: Reaction to the death of Joe Morgan, who was raised in Oakland and had dealt with a number of health issues in recent years. https://t.co/Mh0aaCDjqY
